ftbquests.chapter.4mars.title: &4Mars
ftbquests.chapter.4mars.quests0.title: Mars
ftbquests.chapter.4mars.quests1.title: Crafts
ftbquests.chapter.4mars.quests2.title: Exploration
ftbquests.chapter.4mars.quests4.title: Craft a &4Netherite Space Helmet
ftbquests.chapter.4mars.quests4.subtitle: The &6netherite space suit&f is an upgraded version of the &6standard space suit&r, featuring permanent fire resistance, more protection and the ability to survive on &6Venus&f and &6Mercury&f. Before you travel to these planets, you must craft the &6netherite space suit armour&f or else you will burn to death.
ftbquests.chapter.4mars.quests5.subtitle: The &6energizer&r is a machine capable of &apowering items&r and storing large amounts of &benergy&r. To &echarge an item&r, &apower the energizer&r and then right-click on the energizer with that item. It stores 2 million &benergy&r, making it capable of &ccharging machines for a very long time&r. It also retains its &benergy&r when &bbroken&r.
ftbquests.chapter.4mars.quests6.subtitle: &6Fuel&r is hard to get; it &arequires venturing out&r to the ocean, looking for &boil spouts&r. The &3Cryo Freezer&r introduces a new way to obtain a better fuel &3Cryo Fuel&r. &3Cryo Fuel&r is much more efficient than &arefined fuel&r, allowing you to launch a rocket with just one &9bucket&r.
ftbquests.chapter.4mars.quests7.subtitle: &6Oxygen Sensor&r is a machine that produces a &credstone signal&r when oxygen is detected.
ftbquests.chapter.4mars.quests8.title: Craft a &5Ostrum Sliding Door
ftbquests.chapter.4mars.quests10.title: Defeat &4Martian Raptor
ftbquests.chapter.4mars.quests11.descrip: - Now that you can fly to &6Venus&r and &6Mercury&r, your new goal is to gather enough &bCalorite&r to build the ultimate rocket.
ftbquests.chapter.4mars.quests14.title: Obtain &bCryo Fuel
ftbquests.chapter.4mars.quests15.title: to &eVenus
ftbquests.chapter.4mars.quests16.title: Craft a &8Launch Pad
ftbquests.chapter.8the_prision.title: &7The Prison
ftbquests.chapter.8the_prision.quests0.s: The entrance to the &8Prison &rspawns randomly throughout the &aOverworld&r.
ftbquests.chapter.8the_prision.quests1.s: Spawns in &1The Lair&r, which can be found underground in the &8Prison &rdimension. To deal damage to the &dConjunctivius&r, you must first kill the tentacles.
ftbquests.chapter.8the_prision.quests2.s: Going through the elevator found in the last floor of the prision will get you to the Promenade.\n \n&eIt is suggested to bring a waystone or a pocket wormhole with you to come back to your home.
ftbquests.chapter.8the_prision.quests3.s: Cell Crafters allow you to make various melee and ranged weapons for your armory in the Mine Cells.
ftbquests.chapter.8the_prision.quests4.s: Monster Cells drop from monsters in the &8Prison &rdimension.
ftbquests.chapter.8the_prision.quests5.s: Some weapons that can be made in the Cell Crafter require Cell-Infused Steel to make. Keep this in mind.
ftbquests.chapter.8the_prision.quests6.s: The Health Flask is a really useful item that heals you 10%% of your maximum health and grants regeneration for a few seconds.
ftbquests.chapter.8the_prision.quests6.d: &eCan be cell crafted with Guts and Monster Cells.
&9 Applied Energistics 2
This Questline will get you familiarized with the basics of AE2. You should be able to get basic power generation as well as a storage system started here!
Preparing to Find Meteorites 1

The Charger provides a way to charge supported tools through the ME Network or manually using a crank. It can also be used to create Charged Certus Quartz Crystal from Certus Quartz Crystal, and Meteorite Compass from Compass.
Preparing to Find Meteorites 2

To craft a meteorite compass, charge a normal compass in a Charger. This can be done very early by using a Wooden Crank.The Meteorite Compass points in the direction of the nearest Meteorite within a range of 2,700 blocks. If the compass is spinning rapidly there is Sky Stone in your chunk! If the compass is spinning slowly, then you need to explore more because you're out of range of the nearest Meteorite.
Your First Meteorite

Before you head out to find your first Meteorite make sure to have an Iron Pickaxe or better. Meteorites are made out of a very hard material called Sky Stone which requires it. Make sure you mine to the center of the meteorite to collect the Certus Quartz Crystals, Certus Quartz Blocks and your Inscriber Presses!
Inscriber Presses
Inscriber Presses are found in the Sky Chest at the center of a Meteorite. They can be used to create circuits in an Inscriber.
Now that you have some Certus Quartz Crystals it's time to charge them. Toss one into the Charger you made earlier and get to cranking!

This crystal possesses the unique ability to absorb and convert energy from one form to another, and is the foundation of all ME technology. Fluix Crystal is crafted by placing Charged Certus Quartz Crystal , Nether Quartz and Redstone Dust in water. It will quickly start to react, and result in a Fluix Crystal.

To craft the processors required for more advanced machines, you'll need the Inscriber. Each type of processor has an associated press, which you will find in meteorites. Each operation requires 1k AE charged up.
Rotating Your Machines
A wrench made of Certus Quartz Crystal or Nether Quartz. Useful for rotating blocks, and removing individual parts from cables.
Powering your Network 2

A modified furnace capable of generating AE Power instead of smelting ores. When placed on an ME Network it will charge Energy Cell or power other Network Devices.The Vibration Chamber will burn almost any solid burnable fuel for power. It will slow, or accelerate the burn depending on how much power it is able to store vs what is wasted. Generates between 1 and 10 AE/t depending on its burn speed.
Storing Energy 1
Stores up to 200,000 AE. They do not accept power directly, but are used to add additional power storage to an already existing ME Network.
Storing Energy 2
Stores AE energy up to 1.6 million units. They do not accept power directly but are used to add additional power storage to an already existing ME Network.
Powering Your Network 1
The Energy Acceptor converts energy from external systems into AE and stores it in the network.The following energy systems are supported: Forge Energy / Redstone Flux 2 FE = 1 AE.
Sharing Power Between Networks
A part designed to share energy between two ME Networks without sharing anything else, also used to craft Fluix ME Glass Cable.
Used in the creation of Calculation Processors in an Inscriber.
Used in the creation of Engineering Processors in an Inscriber.
Used in the creation of Logic Processors in an Inscriber.
Used in the creation of all Processors.
Silicon can be crafted by smelting Certus Quartz Dust. It's used alongside an Inscriber and Inscriber Silicon Press to create Printed Silicon.

Used to accelerate crystal growth, which allows you to create Certus Quartz Crystal andFluix Crystal from crystal dust. Must be powered by an ME Network via the top or bottom, and consumes a steady 8 ae/t while plugged in. Crystal Seeds must be in an adjacent water block to be effected, the seeds will shimmer more rapidly when in the presence of a powered Crystal Growth Accelerator. Can only connect to cables, or other networked machines on the top and bottom of the machine.
Used alongside an Inscriber and Inscriber Logic Plate to create a Printed Logic Circuit.
Used alongside an Inscriber and Inscriber Calculation Plate to create a Printed Calculation Circuit.
Used alongside an Inscriber and Inscriber Engineering Plate to create a Printed Engineering Circuit.
Any #c:ender_pearl_dusts
Certus Quartz
Any #c:certus_quartz
Medium tier processor.
Most Advanced Processor.
Most basic processor.
Redstone is a component when creating Processors.

A component required for making item storage cells. Storage Cells are one of the core mechanics of storage in Applied Energistics 2, there are three kinds: one for items, one for fluids, and one for regions of space. These ones store items only.

The ME Chest is the simplest way to use a Storage cell, it will give you direct access to the contents of the cell placed inside. It can be powered stand alone with external power, or as part of a ME Network. When on a network, the storage of the chest will be available to any other devices in the same network using an assigned Channel. When used without a network, the chest will not transfer full stacks at once, capping transfers at 38 items instead.
Used to display inventories of ME Chests and to hold Storage Drives.
A component used to create an ME Terminal.
Fluix ME Glass Cable is the simplest cable to make, transfers power and up to 8 Channels. It comes in 17 different colors, the default being Fluix, and can be dyed any color using any of the 16 dyes.
A component used to create an ME Terminal.
A component used in the creation of an ME Terminal.
A component used in the creation of an illuminated panel.

The ME Controller is the routing hub of a ME Network. Without it, only up to 8 devices can interact, any more and everything stops working.It is not possible to have 2 ME Controller in one ME Network.Unlike most ME Network devices, the ME Controller does not require channels, rather it emits them 8 or 32 per side, depending how many channels the device supports.
Sky Stone Blocks are crafted by melting Sky Stone in a furnace.
A block designed to do one thing, store Storage Cells. This block holds 10 storage cells so you can tightly pack your storage into a very small space.
Fluid Cells are the same as Item Cells, but instead of storing items they store fluids.
Storage components are the base of any cell you will make in AE2.
Portable cells are regular cells, but you can open them up like a backpack (minus the keybind). These still require energy, but can be great early game if your backpack isn't doing enough for you.
About Portable Cells
ftbquests.chapter.archon.title: &bSpellcasting
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests0.title: First Magic Steps
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests0.subtitl: Welcome to the world of runes. This is where we make use of runes and mana to create magic spells, weaponry and even armor. Are you ready to learn the world of sorcery and runes?
Are you ready to become a Sorcerer?
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests1.subtitl: Beneath the depths of the world are Earth Essences, finding them will be no small task as the world underground is huge.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests2.subtitl: Beyond the void lie the End Essences found within End Islands, they will be very difficult to find unless you're determined enough.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests3.subtitl: You'll need this altar if you wanna trade with a Wizard Villager who will sell you magic runes to use.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests4.subtitl: This Rune is used around Arcane Magic.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests5.subtitl: This Rune is used around Fire Magic.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests6.subtitl: This Rune is used around Frost Magic.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests7.title: Alchemy on a Stick
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests7.subtitl: The Channeler is a wand that can infuse mana into certain blocks that will create its crafted version or a new magic material. Test out some materials.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests7.descrip: You may also hold the channeler in your off hand and a block of your chosen metal to work.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests8.title: Find a Spire
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests8.subtitl: Spires are tall towers found in forest and mountain biomes that contain certain loot found there. Watch out for leeches!
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests9.title: Are they made of Papyrus?
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests9.subtitl: These Ancient Scrolls are used to help enhance a person's mana by either increasing one's capacity or mana regeneration capability.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests10.title: Sorcerer's Metal
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests10.subtit: Looks like you figured out how to use the Channeler. Maybe you can do more with this material?
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests11.title: Sorcerer's Helmet
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests11.subtit: The Mask of Power boosts mana regeneration to 4 Mana per second while wearing it.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests12.subtit: A Mana Catalyst boosts the mana capacity of all player with an extra 50 Mana with the radius of 16 blocks.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests13.subtit: An upgraded Mana Catalyst that boosts the mana capacity to 100 with a radius of 22 blocks.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests14.subtit: A powerful Mana Catalyst that boosts the mana capacity to 200 within the range of 34 blocks.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests15.subtit: The Sword allows the user to launch a small cloud of slowness to nearby targets.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests16.subtit: The Charm allows the holder to walk on water when held in main hand and breathe underwater when inside the inventory.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests17.subtit: The Bow launches a Ghast fireball and increases speed of the shot the longer the bow is pulled back.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests18.subtit: Like The Wither, the Stave grants the user the ability to launch wither skulls against targets.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests19.subtit: The Coat grants the wearer fire resistance and the implosion ability to cause explosion damage, the more mana the higher the damage.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests20.subtit: The Blade grants the wielder the ability to teleport 8 blocks in the direction they're facing.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests21.subtit: The Scepter grants the wielder the ability to teleport 10 blocks away in the direction they're facing, but will always cause implosion damage.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests22.subtit: The Mace slams the ground, flinging around nearby targets around the user into the air and receive fall damage. Does not damage pets.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests23.subtit: This ancient fist... perhaps S'kellak may help upgrade it.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests24.subtit: The Axe grants the user a few seconds of resistance and ability to deflect projectiles away from the user.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests25.subtit: The Pedestal is used to summon bosses using the right ingredients. You can shift click on it to remove all ingredients. Right click holding the ingredients onto the pedestal as there's no GUI.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests25.descri: The ingredients to summon the bosses are in your Grimoire.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests26.subtit: The Crusher turns all target souls into mana. 20 mana per mob kill, 30 mana per player kill, and 50 mana per boss kill.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests27.title: Grim Reaper's Toys
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests27.subtit: The Scythe grants the wielder a chance to reap out souls from their preferred target. The Staff of Undead is used to summon minions when given a core.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests28.title: Soul of a Creature
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests28.subtit: A soul from any mob harvested by a soul scythe. It is a 5%% chance to drop for every kill.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests29.title: Soul of a Player
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests29.subtit: A soul from any player, witch, and illager, harvested by a soul scythe. It is a 5%% chance to drop from the mentioned targets.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests30.title: Soul of a Boss
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests30.subtit: A soul from a powerful entity, harvested by the soul scythe, will always drop.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests31.subtit: You can use the soul core to summon a standard Skelt. They cannot be given any gear.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests32.subtit: You can use this soul core to summon a Skelt that can be given armor, both modded and vanilla. Cannot change their iron sword to any weapon.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests33.subtit: You can use this soul core to summon a giant Skelt. Good as a tank as they are quite slow but have a lot of HP and slow attack. You cannot give it any gear.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests34.title: Alchemy, but for Spellbooks
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests34.subtit: The Scripture Table grants the player the ability to craft spell tomes using various ingredients. Similar to alchemy.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests38.subtit: The Wand of Fire, can only use fire spells that are found in the Nether.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests39.subtit: The Wand of Sky, can only use sky spells found in villages.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests40.subtit: The Wand of Water, can only use water spells found in Ocean structures and fishing.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests41.subtit: The Wand of End, can only use end spells found in End Cities or Strongholds.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests42.subtit: The Wand of Earth, can only use earth spells found in temples and mineshafts.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests43.title: Fire Spells
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests44.title: Water Spells
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests45.title: Sky Spells
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests46.title: Earth Spells
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests47.title: End Spells
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests48.title: Thor's Breath
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests48.subtit: As the name implies, it contains lightning that can be released onto the ground when thrown. Can also be created when an empty bottle is struck by lightning.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests49.subtit: Magical Bookshelves are not only good for decoration, but used by Wizard Villagers to allow trade with magical trinkets.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests50.subtit: Pixie Leaves are created with leaf blocks and channeler.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests51.subtit: Spry Dust is created by infusing sand with mana using the Channeler.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests52.title: Magical Farmer
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests52.subtit: Wearing these boots grants the wearer to fertilize plants and crops using mana and by crouching.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests53.title: Ecofriendly TNT
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests53.subtit: Combustion Charges are used to dig out a 7x7 area on the ground or wall, good for mining.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests54.subtit: The Fire Harvester increases mob loot chance related to fire.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests55.subtit: The Breezy Harvester increases mob loot chance related to wind or air.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests56.subtit: The Soaking Harvester increases mob loot chance related to water.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests57.subtit: The Warping Harvester increases mob loot chance related to the End.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests58.subtit: The Rocky Harvester increases mob loot chance related to the earth.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests59.subtit: Small pouches used to store XP when needed. The pouch can store 550 XP.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests60.subtit: An upgraded pouch that can store up to 2920 XP.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests61.title: Defeat the Earth Elemental
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests61.subtit: You must defeat this creature in order to harness the essence of the earth.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests62.title: Defeat the Sky Elemental
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests62.subtit: You must defeat this creature in order to harness the essence of the skies.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests63.title: Defeat the Fire Elemental
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests63.subtit: You must defeat this creature in order to harness the essence of flame.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests64.title: Defeat the Water Elemental
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests64.subtit: You must defeat this creature in order to harness the essence of the seas.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests65.title: Spellbinding!
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests65.subtit: The Spell Binding Table requires bookshelves surrounding it, and it allows the user to bind spells into a Spell weapon using lapis and XP.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests65.descri: Please check your keybinds when you want to toggle which spells you want to use and press 1, 2, 3 to switch spells.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests66.title: Wizard's First Clothes
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests66.subtit: The Wizard Set is a standard magic set to for novice magic users. Maybe there's a way to gain more power?
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests67.title: Arcane Wizard Set
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests67.subtit: The Arcane Wizard Set grants the wearer increased arcane damage.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests68.title: Frost Wizard Set
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests68.subtit: The Frost Wizard Set grants the wearer increased frost damage.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests69.title: Fire Wizard Set
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests69.subtit: The Fire Wizard Set grants the wearer increased fire damage.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests74.title: Fire Wizard's Sorcery
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests74.subtit: You hold the fire wizard's final weapon. You can summon fireballs, flame breaths and even meteors.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests79.title: Arcane Wizard's Sorcery
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests79.subtit: You hold the arcane wizard's final weapon. You can now increase arcane damage over time and shoot out lasers.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests84.title: Frost Wizard's Sorcery
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests84.subtit: You hold the frost wizard's final weapon. You can now slow and freeze enemies while shielding incoming damage with frost.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests86.subtit: You're not dealing with only Wizards, but Monks as well.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests87.title: Monk Trainee
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests87.subtit: This is where your journey as a holy monk starts, are you ready to harness the power of light?
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests90.title: Prior's Miracle
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests90.subtit: You now hold the prior's strongest weapon. Decimate your enemies that blaspheme against your ideals.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests95.title: Paladin's Miracle
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests95.subtit: You now hold the paladin's strongest weapon. Swing your claymore against enemies that blaspheme against your ideals.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests101.title: Crusader's Miracle
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests101.subti: You now hold the crusader's strongest weapon. Smash your enemies that blaspheme against your ideals.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests106.title: Priest's Miracle
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests106.subti: You now hold the priest's strongest weapon. Send judgement towards your enemies that blaspheme against your ideals.
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests107.title: The Prior Set
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests107.subti: You have chosen the path of the Prior, a superior in a religious order. Are you ready to swing your mace to victory?
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests108.title: The Paladin Set
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests108.subti: You have chosen the path of the Paladin, a holy knight of the sword. Are you ready to swing your claymore to victory?
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests109.title: The Crusader Set
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests109.subti: You have chosen the path of the Crusader, a travelling holy knight of the hammer. Are you ready to swing your great hammer to victory?
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests110.title: The Priest Set
ftbquests.chapter.archon.quests110.subti: You have chosen the path of the Priest, a leader of the church. Are you ready to wield your holy staff to victory?
ftbquests.chapter.artifact_reforging.que: &cS'kellak's Forge
&8[Click to read lore and instructions]
&6Requires completion of &nChapter I&r&6 of Void's Invasion.
&7The Molten Core is a powerful artifact made from the depths of the Cinderstone's Volcano; &cVaaz&7.
&7With it, you can craft powerful and unique artifact weapons that have special abilities and bound to your soul, making it only usable by the one that forged it.
&bEncased Remnants&7 can be used to repair and reforge these weapons. You should also make a &6Hardening Catalyst&7 to make them unbreakable.
Make a Hardening Crystal

A cursed sword that holds the power of an eternal winter. The Frostmourne is a runic artifact infused with soulfrost magic. Legend says whoever wields it will become the ruler of the Death Knights, the Lich King.
&eCan be forged using an Essence of Wrath and an Awakened Lichblade, along with the Molten Core.
&8This item is a tribute to World of Warcraft's Frostmourne.
An agonizing soulfire weapon that gives great resistance to its wielder. Oriented for tanking, but has great fire damage.
&eCan be forged using two Molten Edges along with the Molten Core.
&8This item is a tribute to World of Warcraft's Fyr'alath.
&7A'zhar was a demon that was trapped inside a scythe forged by S'kellak, making this soulfire weapon no ally, be careful when using it because it will try to betray you.
&eCan be forged using a Demonic Essence and a Soulrender, along with the Molten Core.
Forged from remnants of a dying star, the Supernova is an astral weapon that can deal damage using all magic elements, and obliterate any targets with astral bursts.
&eCan be forged using the Essence of Glory and a Starforge, along with the Molten Core.
This soulfire fist can enrage anyone if also wielding its sister weapon; the Fist of Fury, making it a lethal choice for martial artists, using its powerful punches that burn the enemy's soul.
&eCan be forged using an Essence of Wrath and a Fist of Fury, along with the Molten Core.
A molten polearm, made out of Cinderstone and Noctisteel, infused with lightning, used by the long gone leader of the Serkonid race.
&eCan be forged using a Demonic Essence and a Thunderbrand, along with the Molten Core.
&7A pair of astral twin swords that harness the power of the Sun and Moon, using Arcane and Fire powers.
&eCan be forged using an Essence of Glory and an Essence of Wrath. To unleash the twin swords, one must use the Essence of Ash'edar.
&7An ancient Artifact forged using materials from far away stars. When infused with power, it can evolve to greater versions
&eCan be forged using the Essence of Glory and a Wizard Staff, along with the Molten Core.
&cEvolves to one of 5 stronger versions for Arcane, Fire, Frost, Holy or Astral mages within the Upgrade Tree.
&7A cosmic bow infused by the power from the stars of the constellation of Orion.
&cUpgrading your Artifact
&8[Click to read instructions]
&7All artifacts are upgradeable using their &6Upgrade Tree&7.
&7Once you forge your own Artifact, you will unlock its Upgrade Tree. You can access it by pressing &6N&7, and pressing the Molten Core icon at the top left.
&7All Upgrade Trees have up to &67 nodes&7 you can select, with different paths to take.
&7To unlock nodes, you will need to empower you artifact using &6Molten Remnants&7, which are rewarded in quests, or craftable using Mythical Essences.
Continue
&eObtain an Infused Molten Remnant from the Campaign.
&dEternal Knowledge: &eOf the Eternal Forge
&8Secret Knowledge
&8You've forged all Artifact Weapons and unlocked their Mastery. You've held all kinds of power. So let me ask you, what are you going to do with this knowledge?
I've Learnt the Knowledge.

ftbquests.chapter.botania.title: &aBotania
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests0.title: Seedling's First Steps
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests0.subtit: It's time for you to play with nature. What we're going to be looking at is how to make use of the natural mana and soil to gain powerful artifacts and maybe farms. Are you ready?
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests1.title: Mother Nature's Encyclopedia
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests1.subtit: Getting a Lexica Botanica will help you understand the natural world around us. Getting one will be important to progress.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests1.descri: Don't forget to check the Advancements for more hints too.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests2.title: Seedling's Backpack
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests2.subtit: A Flower Pouch is important to have as you will be collecting different colored flowers and it will clog your inventory so a pouch for them is perfect.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests19.title: Natural Alchemy
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests19.subti: The Petal Apothecary is an important item used to creating certain items that will be beneficial to your progression.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests20.title: Purification
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests20.subti: The Pure Daisy is a plant that can 'purify' or tranform any log and stone into materials used to craft more sophisticated tools.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests21.subti: Good start! Now you are ready to generate mana. Be sure to try out the different kinds of flowers as well for fun!
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests22.title: &eAn Ecstatic Vivace
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests22.subti: Now you created a flower with a unique function, good start! Now you can make interesting rituals and creations using these flowers as the base so try out the different kinds of flora with unique properties.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests63.title: Terra?
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests63.subti: This plate is a very special item that is used to create a new ingot by infusing three mana dipped objects. One must use up half a mana pool's capacity in order for it to function properly. Be warned that the ritual will be wasted if the items aren't on the plate.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests64.title: Runestones?
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests64.subti: The Runic Altar is an important item that allows the creation of runes that are used in various tools. You must have it connected with a mana pool and materials to create a certain rune to function.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests65.title: You're a Druid, Harry!
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests65.subti: The Wand of the Forest is an important item to carry around when commanding or redirecting magical items and mana pools to perform a certain function.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests66.title: I thought we can swim in this?
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests66.subti: A Mana Pool is an important item to have as they are used to store in generated or transferred mana in order to be used later.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests67.title: Wireless Mana
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests67.subti: A Mana Spreader is a block that can transfer mana to nearby blocks or structures that can hold mana. They can be rotated or facing a certain block by using the Wand of the Forest.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests68.title: Mana Battery
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests68.subti: A Mana Tablet is used to be able to carry mana around as a portable object and can be used to absorb or deposit mana. Each tablet can hold about half a mana pool's capacity.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests69.title: Natural Steel
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests69.subti: A Terrasteel Ingot is a special ingot that can be used to create a stronger variant of tools made using manasteel ingots, but they're very expensive to create.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests90.title: Manasteel Tools
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests90.subti: These Manasteel Tools are better than iron and can make use of mana to repair itself.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests91.title: Manasteel Armor
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests91.subti: Just like the tools, the Manasteel Armor is better than iron and makes use of mana to repair itself.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests93.title: Manaweave Armor
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests93.subti: This armor set is a specialized set of manasteel armor that makes the cost of mana lesser than the other mana set, only that this armor is weaker in defense.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests94.title: Terraforming
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests94.subti: There are only three weapons for the terrasteel, but they're stronger than their manasteel variant. Also, do your best to raise the rank of your Terra Shatterer.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests95.title: Earthshaker
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests95.subti: The highest rank attainable, such a powerful pickaxe that can drill through the heavens and the earth!
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests96.title: Passive Mana Charger
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests96.subti: This Terrasteel Armor is a stronger version of the Manasteel Armor that can also passively charge your Mana Tablets in your inventory.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests98.subti: Congratulations, you have defeated the boss and now have your rewards. Maybe there's a hard mode with more rewards?
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests99.title: Round Two!
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests99.subti: If you use this, you will have to fight the boss again but harder, are you ready?
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests100.subt: Congratulations, now you earn a chance to gain an artifact, can you collect them all?
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests108.subt: Doing this fight without armor is terrifying. I hope you fought it without creative mode.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests109.subt: This is the better version of the Mana Spreader that you'll craft. More mana payout. Oh, and do try out the different lens that you can attach to your Mana Spreaders.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests110.subt: This is the best mana spreader that Mother Earth can provide for your needs. This is much slower but its payout is much higher.
ftbquests.chapter.collectibles.title: &2&nExplorer's Journal
ftbquests.chapter.collectibles.quests0.s: Hello young explorer! Welcome to the Explorer's Journal where you will gather items that you wouldn't actively find. Are you up for the challenge?
ftbquests.chapter.collectibles.quests1.s: Poseidon has lost all of his fish for his personal aquarium! Help the God of the Sea by finding and fishing up some new specimen for the God and they'll reward you.
ftbquests.chapter.collectibles.quests3.s: Ah yes, Captain Cornelia, a great captain who sailed until she fell into the depths of the freezing oceans, one must be daring enough to find her ship and take her treasures away, if they can find it.
ftbquests.chapter.collectibles.quests4.s: You have done the God of the Sea a huge favor! Now he will reward you for your efforts.
ftbquests.chapter.collectibles.quests5.t: Call Captain back from the dead.
ftbquests.chapter.collectibles.quests5.s: Now that you found a special trinket, one must be curious on how it works. Beware the dead.
ftbquests.chapter.collectibles.quests6.s: This armor was worn by the famous Captain Cornelia to survive the freezing depths of the ocean, will you do your best to collect the entire set and go down into the depths?
ftbquests.chapter.collectibles.quests7.s: Nothing much can be found in such worn out pouches, but maybe you can get lucky?
ftbquests.chapter.collectibles.quests8.s: An armor that makes one act similarly to a pufferfish, but it seems to be a very good set for those who love being reckless and fighting underwater.
ftbquests.chapter.collectibles.quests9.s: The Ice Maze is not only freezing and massive, but it also contains the scary depths of the ocean. Will you be able to take them down and return with the spoils?
You have finally found the captain's hideout, but now you must find her hidden treasure hidden away within.
These weapons looked like they were used by Captain Cornelia's crew, but were eventually lost to the frozen depths, but are now in your hands to test their might.
If you stare at the abyss, the abyss stares back at you. But if you have the courage to face any danger head on, then maybe they will reward you.
Ah, a classic set of aquatic life, from Minecraft itself. Nothing is more memorable than the originals themselves.
Demeter has left her plant life scattered across the world and is challenging anyone who is willing to gather them and satisfy the Goddess of Harvest and Agriculture and be rewarded.
Man, Demeter is very excessive with the number variety of crops there are in the world. Well, it'd better be worth it in the end.
Haven't you wondered if the number of tree varieties are just a combination of other fruit trees in order to produce more?
While not a very large variety of crops under Delight, but it is made up for it by being found fairly quickly.
ftbquests.chapter.collectibles_2.title: &9Collectibles
ftbquests.chapter.collectibles_2.quests0: Welcome, young collector, for here you see before you is a place where trinkets and accessories are gathered and admired by those around you. Are you up for the challenge?
ftbquests.chapter.collectibles_2.quests1: Welcome to The Thing! You must find the Things and collect them for your own benefit. You cannot give each trinket a name, just refer to them as a Thing, nothing more, nothing less.
ftbquests.chapter.collectibles_2.quests3: Hello there, young music enthusiast! Considering that you're here, it means that you know that music is something we all need in our life! And these records are almost lost to time, but we can still salvage them! You must find them and listen to what they have to offer.
ftbquests.chapter.collectibles_2.quests4: While it's important to respect the graves of the dead, finding cool remains is worth showing for display to showcase the history. Once you find them and use the brush to dig them out, give your respect.
ftbquests.chapter.collectibles_2.quests2: Your classic tunes that you can find.
Okay, so these discs in particular might be harder to find and there might be unique records you might not have heard before, good luck.
ftbquests.chapter.collectibles_2.quests3: Ali Bakir - Flow of the Abyss
Ali Baker - Tanker on the Levantine's
ftbquests.chapter.collectibles_2.quests4: SideralisMusic - A Dance of the Blades Part 1 (Prominence OST)
SideralisMusic - A Dance of the Blades Part 2 (Prominence OST)
What kinda umbrella is strong enough to be a shield and indestructible?
ftbquests.chapter.collectibles_2.quests5: Starting to imagine that for every bite of this steak, a cow gets eaten somewhere in the world, and it regrows the steak to its original appearance.
Are there any other colors? Orange seems to standout a lot.
Personally, I wouldn't wear this as it looks ridiculous, but at least you can eat and drink faster.
This doesn't last very long, at most, it's 15 seconds, but worth using.
These goggles are too big for my face! It feels heavy..
A fellow Villager?! Come, let's trade! We have discounts for our kind.
Time to look stylish while killing.
Would've preferred a lucky horseshoe, but this is good too.
Now you see me, now you don't.
ftbquests.chapter.collectibles_2.quests6: The thrill of danger and adrenaline rush fuels me to run faster!
Don't touch me, or you will be shocked to the core.
Isn't this a wither skull but covered in obsidian?
Sick? No worries! It'll go away.
Can't attract a significant other with it, though.
ftbquests.chapter.collectibles_2.quests7: Flying like a bird is gonna be exhausting.
We're basically a mole if we can dig stone with our hands.
Why suck blood from targets with fangs if we can just use our hands, more sanitary.
Snuggly feet with a purring kitty
ftbquests.chapter.collectibles_2.quests8: When wearing running shoes, press B to run and you can zip away! Well, in Minecraft, this just makes our sprint faster.
Gonna need that snorkel and diving suit.
The most legendary artifact, the whoopee cushion. With its majestic appearance and functionality, it's a highly coveted item by jokesters.

A Recall Potion is something one should at least carry around as drinking it will teleport the player to their spawnpoint, a good way to escape or go home quickly. Eugh, it tastes awful though, considering that it uses a pearl. Shouldn't try it as a milk tea.
Just your handy dandy guide to gathering Things. You can choose not to though, but you will feel smarter if you know where you're going.
Using this key will allow one to protect their chests from being stolen and looted just by locking them. Use the key again to unlock your precious chests.

Now I know what you're thinking, why is it named this way? As you can see, the bucket and water content, have been flipped inside out! Now this thing's only purpose is infinite water supply, can't pick anything back up.
So this pouch is basically an ender chest that you can carry around. I wonder if you even need to put down an enderchest in your base anymore?
Okay, so while this looks like a regular monocle, but it enhances the wearer's vision to even work at night as if they're in the day! Now you can be a night owl!
ftbquests.chapter.collectibles_2.quests9: So you know how plants get energy from being under the sun? Well, now with this thing, you can act similarly! But instead of the sun, it can be any nearby light source and now you can heal! Don't plant yourself into the soil though.
So this item is not meant to be consumed at all, just keep it in your inventory and you may or may not end up receiving the effects of your drunken potions without drinking any.

So this tome in particular, is similar to the Recall Potion, but you need displacement pages that can be crafted and if one opens the tome, they can charge it with pearls and save a location that they can teleport to.
Used for the Displacement Tome in order to teleport and write down locations that you are at and can teleport to anytime.
To improve one's mining efficiency, one must wear the proper protection as a miner! And wearing this glove will help you!
If you felt like you just want that extra power in your fist, then wear the riot gauntlet and make havoc! No punching cute things though.
You know how Ghasts and Blazes are always shooting fireballs at you? Now you can do that with this handy scepter, but remember to carry ammunition.
Hades has created a powerful crystal condensing his fire powers and whoever wears it will be immune to fire and even lava damage.
Can't swim fast? Just swim harder!
These magnets are interesting, as they can pull in any item, even if they're not made of metal at all. Wonder if you can pull gravity?
ftbquests.chapter.collectibles_2.quests1: Normally, one being light as a rabbit is an exaggeration, but this thing takes things literally by allowing the wearer to be so light that they can jump really high. Don't break any ankles.
Be as lucky as a leprachaun and turn all your deadly spuds into golden apples.
Are you annoyed with mending or having durability at all? Then craft yourself the most powerful material known to man, and make your item indestructible! Don't let it touch cacti though.
Always feeling short compared to others and can't reach? Then grab yourself the Arm Extender for only 10.99!!
Kinetic Energy? I hardly even know it.
These boots will minimize the amount of fall damage the wearer experience by a huge margin, but just because the damage is less, doesn't mean you should be more reckless.
This watch is very odd and cannot be repaired at all, but it has the magical powers to increase effects by 50%%
A Gleaming Compound is a very precious material that is used to make more powerful Things, as they are very rare, they are definitely worth a lot just to get one.
ftbquests.chapter.create.title: &6Create
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests0.title: &6Welcome to Create!
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests0.subtitl:
Welcome to Create, a steampunk mod that lets you build contraptions to do most things you can think of.

Create offers great guides for most of its items by hovering over them in REI or in your inventory and holding down 'W' to "ponder" the item. This brings up a menu explaining to use said item.

Because of this the chapter is mostly focused on letting you know what exists and giving you a rough outline of the progression of the mod.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests2.subtitl: The basis for more advanced blocks.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests3.subtitl: The basis of most things fluid related in Create.\n\nCan also be used to encase fluid pipes.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests4.subtitl:
In order to make a train you're going to need at least:
- 1 Train Casing
- 1 Train Station
- Enough train tracks to make your railroad.

In order to see how you assemble a train "ponder" the train station.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests5.subtitl: Lets you transfer a redstone signal wirelessly within a range.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests6.subtitl: A redstone component that outputs a signal when in contact with another redstone contact. Perticularly useful for building contraptions.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests7.subtitl: A kinetic source that uses the flow of water as its source of energy. Will generate the same amount of SU at the same RPM as long as one block of flowing water is adjacent.\n\nYou can also swich the look of your water wheel by right-clicking it with pretty much any wood plank (including ones from other mods).
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests8.subtitl: Generates twice as much SU as the regular water wheel but at a slower RPM.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests9.subtitl: Lets you see the current stress and stress capacity of a kinetic network.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests10.subtit: Lets you see the rotational speed of a kinetic network.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests11.subtit: The densest kinetic source. Although it also has the highest complexity, requiring a steady source of water and heat.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests13.title: Valve Handles
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests13.subtit: Similar to a Hand Crank but only turns a certain amount of degrees with each interaction.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests14.subtit: The simplest way to generate kinetic energy, by using yourself as the power source.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests15.title: Blaze Burner
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests15.subtit: In order to get brass you're going to need to heat a mechanical mixer that's mixing copper and zinc.\n\n the Empty Blaze burner can be filled by right-clicking it on either a blaze spawner or a blaze.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests16.subtit: A machine that can autocraft shapeless recepies aswell as mix things like potions.\n\nNeeds to rotate at at least 30 rpm to function
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests17.subtit: Can be used to place or extract large bodies of liquid.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests18.subtit: Allows for the extraction of liquids from items.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests19.subtit: Used for filling items with fluids and crafting certain items using fluids.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests20.subtit: Allows contraptions to transfer fluids to blocks.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests21.subtit: Lets you use SU to break blocks, can also be attached to contraptions to make tunnel bores and the like.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests22.subtit: Blocks that can fell trees or allow contraptions to fell trees. As well as some crafting recipes like cutting blocks or stripping logs.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests23.subtit: Blocks that allow contraptions to harvest crops.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests24.subtit: Blocks that allow contraptions to create farmland or launch entities.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests25.subtit: Lets you clear and pave whilst riding a train.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests26.subtit: Essentially the an upgrade to the millstone, provides some different recipes so it might be worth keeping both around.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests27.subtit: Blocks that both allow for automatic crafting of normal recipes and the crafting of recipes that are bigger than a normal crafting table would allow for.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests29.subtit: An item used to craft more advanced mechanical items.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests30.subtit: Allows for fine tuning of rpm.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests31.subtit: Allows you to control the train.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests32.subtit: Gives off a redstone signal when detecting a train.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests33.subtit: Used to controll the flow of trains across tracks and intersections of tracks.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests34.subtit: The block that deals with train assembly and dissasembly.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests35.subtit: Lets you schedule trains so that mobs or blaze burnders can drive them.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests36.title: Train Tracks
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests36.subtit: The thing your train goes on.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests38.subtit: Lets you place down a mirror that assists you in building symmetrical things.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests39.subtit: Grinding it all down to dust.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests40.subtit: A very versitile machine that can pull and push entities aswell as wash, haunt, blast and smoke items.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests41.subtit: When placed on the Encased Fan the Nozzle changes the area of effect of the pushing/pulling into a sphere instead of a line.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests42.subtit: Stores pressurized air for usage with a diving helmet.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests43.subtit: An upgraded version of the Copper Backtank.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests44.subtit: A helmet that lets you use air from an equipped tank to breathe underwater.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests45.subtit: Allows you to walk underwater like you do on land as well as walk on belts without them moving you.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests46.subtit: An upgraded version of the Copper Diving Helmet.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests47.subtit: An upgraded version of the Copper Diving Boots.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests48.subtit: A repeater that sends a pulse after a configurable amount of time.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests49.subtit: A redstone component that extends a pulse to a configurable amount.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests50.subtit: Allows you to setup a sequence of rotations that are executed upon the block receiving a redstone signal.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests51.subtit: A block that can monitor the fill levels of inventories and tanks.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests52.subtit: A block that can look for specific items in the world or in inventories.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests53.subtit: A redstone component that toggles its state with every redstone pulse.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests54.subtit: A redstone component that toggles on when recieving a redstone signal on one side and off when recieviing a signal on anoter side.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests55.subtit: Basically an advanced sign that updates faster if provided with higher RPM.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests56.subtit: Lets you display real-time information to a connected display board or nixie tube.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests57.subtit: A lever that can be set to output any redstone level.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests60.subtit: Lets you instantly break most Create blocks by shift + right-clicking. And rotate them by right-clicking.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests61.subtit: "A fancier rope pulley"\n\nAllows for the creation of elevators.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests62.subtit: Some fluids can be infinity extracted from the world as long as the pool the hose pulley is extracting from contains 10000 or more source blocks.\n\nYou can search in REI for the fluids that apply using by typing "$create:bottomless"
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests63.subtit: Allows you to stop rotational force coming through when powered by a redstone signal.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests64.subtit: An item that allows for increased reach.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests65.subtit: A simple machine with massive potential. Can place blocks but also use items on blocks/entities.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests66.subtit: Lets you create your own custom functional clock.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests67.subtit: When placed in front of the Encased Fan this allows it to haunt items.\n\nNotably sand into soul sand.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests68.subtit: When placed in front of the Encased Fan this allows it to smoke items.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests69.subtit: When placed in front of the Encased Fan this allows it to blast items.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests70.subtit: When placed in front of the Encased Fan this allows it to wash items.\n\nNotably soul sand into nether quartz.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests71.subtit: A block that allows input and output of inventories 1 item at a time.\n\nOne thing not mentioned by the ponder is that the funnel can drop items on the ground when placed on an inventory and will only keep 1 item on the ground if it's close enough to the block the item lands on.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests72.subtit: Tunnels are used to manage the flow of items on belts.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests73.subtit: An upgrade to the andesite tunnel allowing more configurability in how to deal with items.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests74.subtit: A more advanced funnel that allows for filtering and higher stack sizes.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests75.title: Item Manipulation
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests77.subtit: Chutes are used to transfer between inventories vertically.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests80.subtit: A filter that can filter by attributes like "can be smelted" or "from Create".
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests81.subtit: It's really just a belt that doesn't move.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests82.subtit: Weighted Ejectors can throw items accuratly long distances.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests83.subtit: A multi-block item storage that can't be accessed manually.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests85.subtit:
Terminoloy:

Stress Units(SU) a number that describes how much stress something generates or requires to run.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests87.subtit: Can be used to halve or double the rotational speed of connected chaindrives when recieving a redstone signal.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests88.subtit: Lets you reverse the direction of rotation by applying redstone.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests89.subtit: Allows for multiple paralell rotational outputs.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests90.subtit: Lets you turn off parts of contraptions while they are formed.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests91.subtit: As the name implies this item allows you to glue blocks together. Perticularly useful when making contraptions.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests92.subtit: Allows for the creation of contraptions that move up and down.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests93.subtit: Allows for contraptions that traverse rails in the same way minecarts do.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests94.subtit: Allows for contraptions that rotate around a point in space, particularly useful for farms.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests95.title: Mechanical Pistons
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests95.subtit: Allows for movement of structures linearly using rotational force.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests96.subtit: Allows for contraptions that move across gantries.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests97.subtit: A useful block for building contraptions.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests98.subtit: Sticks to blocks when powered by redstone.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests100.subti: Since most blocks in Create don't allow for manual extraction and insertion of liquids these pipes are rather useful.\n\nCan also be used to create infinite water by extracting from a source-block that has 2 source-blocks adjacent to it.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests101.subti: The main block used for bulk fluid storage.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests102.title: Seats
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests103.title: Cogwheels
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests104.subti: Essential for any person working with Create. Allows you to see more information about blocks like stress impact.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests105.subti: Ever wanted to pipe liquids into your blaze burners? Just hand them a straw and they'll slurp it straight from the pipe.\n\nYou can press 'U' on the straw to see what liquids it accepts as well as burn times.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests106.subti: A motor that converts energy(E) into kinetic energy(SU) at any rpm.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests107.subti: Generates energy(E) from kinetic energy, the amount generated is dependent on the rpm and caps at 256E/t
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests108.subti: Crafts plates into rods and rods into wires.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests110.subti: A multi-block structure that lets you store large amounts of energy.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests111.subti: Connectors insert/extract energy from/into blocks and wires are used to connect between connectors.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests112.subti: A redstone component that only allows energy(E) to flow when it's receiving a redstone signal.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests113.title: Conductors
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests113.subti: Conductors allow you to activate redstone whilst looking at them and can also carry your toolbox around.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests115.subti: Lets you see through the eyes of a conductor as well as control their movement.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests116.subti: Used to visualise and control which direction trains go in intersections.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests117.subti: Same as the Andesite Track Switch but also allows for switching for scheduled trains.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests118.subti: Lets you couple and decouple trains without dissasembly.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests119.subti: Used to visualise valid paths for trains.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests120.subti: Copycat blocks allow you to make steps and panels out of things that typically cannot take those shapes.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests121.title: &dOne Cookie to Rule Them All
ftbquests.chapter.c_bewitchment.title: &c Witchcraft \& Rituals
Hello there, I assume you're here because you want to become a witch, right? You've come to the right place.. this is where it begins, young witch.
Make sure to read the Book of Shadows if you want to understand more in-depth of Bewitchment.
An interesting tree, it has unique properties that allow it to 'bleed out', perhaps you'll find it useful for your future endeavors. They're found in Nether Fortresses.
This tree contains the essence of knowledge and intelligence, perhaps this will be useful in your future endeavors. They're found scattered around in forests.
These trees have a smell of death around them, perhaps this will be useful with your endeavors later. They're found in taigas and swamps.
This tree has the properties of life itself, perhaps it'll be useful for your future endeavors. They're found in savannas.
A special knife for us witches, it's going to be important for our rituals and scratching trees. Take good care of it.
This will be very fun for our uses. Getting taglocks of other players will allow us to bind them to a ritual.
Ew, this is some weird goop that you got from a ghost.. well, it'll still be useful for what we need..
This is a very nice coffin, comfortable and dark enough for a player to sleep during the day time until night.
Having a poppet like this will make the target either cursed or protected, depending on how you use them, and there may be more than one type of poppet.
ftbquests.chapter.c_bewitchment.quests10: Ever felt that you have too many poppets in your inventory? These shelves will be perfect for your needs.
ftbquests.chapter.c_bewitchment.quests11: Demon Hearts are useful in creating special magical items that may be beneficial to the witch, although they may be difficult to obtain as you need to summon these demons.
ftbquests.chapter.c_bewitchment.quests12: The cauldron is perfect to brew potions using special ingredients that you can grow and scrape from.
ftbquests.chapter.c_bewitchment.quests20: The Besmircher is able to disguise themselves in front of demons and are able to trade with them.
ftbquests.chapter.c_bewitchment.quests21: The Alchemist is a master of witch brews and can double the duration effects of said brews when one wears it.
ftbquests.chapter.c_bewitchment.quests22: The Hedgewitcher is able to increase crop bounty when one wears such clothing.
ftbquests.chapter.c_bewitchment.quests23: An altar carries the magical energy that us witches use in doing rituals. In order to increase the capacity, one must decorate their altar with the appropriate materials and plant more trees around it.
ftbquests.chapter.c_bewitchment.quests24: A braizer is used for cursing, incense and rituals so having one will be vital if we want to be successful, young witch.
ftbquests.chapter.c_bewitchment.quests25: Chalk is important for a witch as they're the foundation of rituals as they need to draw a circle in order to activate. It's best to have one of each type of chalk ready.
ftbquests.chapter.c_bewitchment.quests26: Salt is important in not just for food seasoning, but it is good for warding off evil spirits and demons that may go after you. Salt is good for barriers.
ftbquests.chapter.c_bewitchment.quests27: At least you can enjoy a nice snack while you use garlic for magic purposes.
ftbquests.chapter.c_bewitchment.quests28: Getting these two items are essential if you would like to make use of some items that are for curses or deooration. They're found by killing demons and demonhounds.
ftbquests.chapter.c_bewitchment.quests29: A witch's item to be immune to fire at the cost of some magical energy. They're also fireproof.
ftbquests.chapter.c_bewitchment.quests30: This will prevent any mob from spawning within a 24 block radius.
ftbquests.chapter.c_bewitchment.quests31: Any mob who will come into contact with it will be teleported within a 64 block radius.
ftbquests.chapter.c_bewitchment.quests32: This bramble will grow a special fruit that can be used to create food items that will restore magical energy when consumed.
ftbquests.chapter.c_bewitchment.quests33: Prevents from any entity from passing through, unless you sneak to get passed.
ftbquests.chapter.c_bewitchment.quests34: Send any mob flying into the air when coming into contact.
ftbquests.chapter.c_bewitchment.quests35: Firewall, but for entities, not viruses.
Burns any mob that comes into contact with the bramble.
ftbquests.chapter.c_bewitchment.quests36: A witch's best friend. Used to create food items.
ftbquests.chapter.dastral_realm.title: &dAstral Realm
ftbquests.chapter.deeper_and_darker.ques: Used to negate the darkness in &8&lThe Otherside.

Before lighting the portal, you must first remove all &3Sculk Veins &rfrom the inner frame. After the frame is cleared, you can right click it with the &bHeart of The Deep &rthat you got earlier from killing The Warden.
Rare chance of spawning after breaking an &8Ancient Vase&r.
Found by stepping on Infested Sculk
Can be tamed with enchanted &cNetherite Chestplates&r. When tamed, they will occasionally drop enchanted books.
ftbquests.chapter.dmastering_fatew.title: &dMastering Fate
ftbquests.chapter.d_the_art_of_transmogr: &dTransmogrification&7 is a type of magic that allows you to &echange the shape of any object without altering its function&7, letting you to mask your items into another, including weapons and armors. It does not give any benefit aside from being purely cosmetic.
&7To start off, you must craft a &dTransmogrification Table&7. This magic is powered with &dAmethyst&7, so you'll have to get some each time you want to transform any item.
No items will be consumed, but to change the shape you'll need to own the desired item.
&7If you dont want to display an armor piece, or a weapon, you can hide the items!
&7By using a &dVoid Fragment&7 as the transmoggable material
ftbquests.chapter.eenchanting.title: &eEnchanting
ftbquests.chapter.einformation_7new_mech: &7All shields have new mechanics from the &eShield Overhaul&7 mod.
- &e&lBashing &r&7Attack while blocking to perform a shield bash. &7This will stun the target for 1 second, unless it's a boss.
&7Combat mechanics were altered by the &eBetter Combat&7 mod.
- &6&lWeapons &r&7Each weapon has its own attack animation and time.
- &6&lHold to attack &r&7You can hold the attack button to keep attacking continuosly.
&7This tutorial questline explains how combat works, from changed mechanics to how to build yourself.
&eAlthough this is an early game tutorial, it extends up to end game builds. More quests will appear as you progress.
&7Most of this questline is just reading, &cplease make sure to read&7 if you want to truly understand things, as it's important information.
&eHow do I know what gear to get?

&7The following guides will direct you what to look for depending on specific build types. These are not fully fleshes builds, they're just guides for you to follow on what gear to choose depending on your gameplay.
&eThe difficulty shown applies to both how hard it is to play it, and how hard it is to make the build &7(Although gameplay difficulty has more priority)&7.
&eThis part of the questline can get complex! To learn more about getting Skill Books please read the Spellcasting questline.
&6For full guides on specific builds, check the official wiki!
&7Stats, also known as attributes, are a series of numbers associated to your character which allow other things to scale from.
&7For example, Haste defines how fast you attack, while health defines how much health you have, etc.
&7The next quests will explain the main stats and how each is important for what use specifically.
&eStats are a core part of your gear, it's important that you understand what stats you need and which you don't depending how you want to build yourself.
&eCore Stats are the stats that everyone uses to an extent.
&7Either because you already have a default amount (like Health) or because any piece of gear will give the stat (like Haste and Armor)
&eVarious statistics that are designed for ranged options.
&7While Physical Damage is used by everyone, ranged builds will prefer other statistics depending on what path they take; &eArchery&7 (Ranged Physical) or &eSpellcasting &7(Ranged Magic)
&7Magic can also be used by melee, with Spellblade builds.
&7Making you attack or switch weapons faster. It also scales with certain weapons and items. Particular focus for "Rogue" builds, or any fast attacking build.
&eIncreases the amount of damage your swings/punches deal.
&7The main statistic for melee builds, as it increases the damage you deal and scales with anything that deals physical damage, such as melee weapons and melee abilities.
&7It's obtained from armor pieces, but enemies and bosses will also have an amount armor by default.
&7Reduces the incoming &6Physical Damage&7 at a higher range. It's more effective on high damage hits, hence why it's known as the "Anti One Shot" stat.
&7Increases the maximum amount of damage you can take until you die.
&7Decreases the amount of Energy (Hunger) you lose passively.
&eElemental powers are the third strongest to exist, also known as &otertiary&r&e powers.
&7Although there are other tertiary powers, Elemental ones come from the Creation, Holy and Soul.
&eArcane, Frost and Fire&7 can be used by various Spell Books, alone or together, they're all three part of the &eAstral &7hybrid power.
&eLightning&7 is used by some weapons like the Thunderwrath artifact, consists of an important power for Valkyries.
&ePrimordial Powers are the second strongest, also known as Secondary powers.
&eHoly&7 is used by Priests and Paladins to support allies.
&eSoul&7 is used in combination of Elemental powers, to form hybrid powers such as &eSoulfire&7 and &eSoulfrost&7, used mainly by some Artifacts.
&eDecaying powers are the powers of Death.
&eBlood&7 is used by Blood Death Knights, a tank specialization that sustains itself.
&eUnholy&7 is used by Unholy Death Knights, bruisers that bring diseases to enemies.
&eHybrid stats either are a mix of two stats, or a stat that applies globally to both melee and ranged classes.
&eLethality and Magic Penetration are the same stat with different names. They ignore a percentage of your target's Armor or Magic Protection.
&7For example, if you have 16%% Lethality and your enemy has 100 armor, you'll hit them as if they had 84 Armor instead (as it reduces their armor -16%%).
&eAstral Power is the combination of 3 elemental powers: &dArcane, &cFire&e and &bFrost&e.
&7This hybrid power is used by Astral Mages, or by Astral Spellblades. With artifacts such as &dSingularity&8 (from Ekavar)&7 and &dSupernova&7 scaling with these stats.
&7There are spell books that use Astral Power too, such as the &dRunic Invocations&7 book.
&7Increases the specific spell power by a percentage of your Physical Damage.
&7Increases your Phyiscal Damage by a percentage of your amount of the specified spell power.
&7This stat scales the damage dealt with Ranged Weapons that throw projectiles, such as bows, crossbows or guns. It's obtained through Talents, Jewelry and from the ranged weapons themselves.
&7This stat increases the draw speed from a bow/crossbow, or the rate of fire from guns/cannons.
&eThese powers buff the casting process of Spellcaster Mages.
&eSpell Critical Chance&7 increases the chance of your spells to deal critical damage.
&eSpell Critical Damage&7 increases the damage of your critical spells by a percentage.
&eSpell Haste&7 increases the speed of your casts, making them shorter.
&7It also scales with other things like Rolling.
&eEnchantments are a core part of your gear, they heavily increase the efficiency of your gear.
&7You can check the full enchanting guide on the wiki, the Enchanting tutorial is currently being built <3
&eProtectors (Also called Tanks) are supports that focus on protecting others by taking the damage from enemies.
&7Protectors focus towards being the first to attack enemies, or taunt them using active talents such as &9Bone Armor&7.

&7As a protector your main priority should be &cMaximum Health&7 and &eArmor&7. The best pieces with these stats are &eDiamond Armor&7 and its upgrades, as they'll provide the maximum amount of Armor points (and Toughness) as possible, and later on also Maximum Health.
&eKeep in mind that a tank's damage is mediocre compared to other builds. Its purpose is to tank, not to deal damage.
&eWarriors are melee builds that swing slow but hard.
&7They are the definition of a "Burst" class; as although they swing slow their damage will be high, just not as constant as a DPS build.
&eMages are versatile ranged builds that use magic of certain elements such as Arcane, Fire and Frost.
&7A Mage's job is to deal damage from a distance using magic casted from a Spell Book.

&7Your priority will depend on the path you decide to take; the element your want to focus on. As starting gear, you can get a &eWizard Staff&7 (or any staff of the specific element) and &eWizard Robes&7.
&eUnlock Tier II Guides for Specific Elements
&eRogues are melee builds that focus on attacking fast, dealing constant damage to targets.
&7They are the definition of a "DPS" class; the focus is towards constant damage, unlike Burst builds which are focused towards high damage without being constant.
&7Stat-wise the main priority is &eHaste&7, then &6Physical Damage&7. Gear-wise you should look for fast attacking weapons that are one-handed so you can dual wield them.
&eRangers are ranged builds that use weapons such as Bows, Crossbows or Guns to deal damage using projectiles.
&7They can be built as a DPS-oriented build, or Burst-oriented build, depending on the gear you take and stats you prioritize.
&7Main priority is &2Ranged Damage&7, obtained from talents and the gear you're using. If you want a faster fire rate, then you should also prioritize &aDraw Speed&7.
&eKeep in mind that archers are squishier.
&eAn alternative path that combines both Rogues and Mages.
&7With spellblades you can be a melee rogue that uses magic abilities. You can start with a Spellblade of any element you'd like, and its Techniques spellbook for the abilities.

&7Priorities should be a mix of both Physical Damage and the elemental power of your choosing. Fate choice can be either the fate of your element, or &9Shadow Techniques&7 if focusing more on attacking than spells.
&eThe Runic Invocations use Astral Magic, power from three elements: Arcane, Fire and Frost.
&7Runic Invocations are very strong when used right, but are the most difficult mages.
&7Now that you've reached enough level to get a Fate Talent, you should choose &9Knowledge Of Runes and Stars &7as it provides &eAstral Power&7.
&eHealers are supports that protect their allies by healing and giving magical temporal shields.
&7Your main focus is &eHoly Power&7, obtained through talents and gear. You can use the &6Holy Book&7 to cast healing spells.
&7You might also focus on a bit of defense, such as maximum health or movement speed to escape from targets, as your damage won't be as high.
&eKeep in mind that a healer's damage is mediocre compared to other builds. Its purpose is to heal, not to deal damage.
&eBards are supports that buff allies with damage, haste, healing and other buffs.
&cYou need to be in a party with your allies to give them buffs! &8(/openpac-parties command)

&7Bards are special, as they don't have a specific gear or stat. The only requirement is to have the &9A Bard's Tale&7 talent fated. They can use specific instruments to give specific buffs as described in the talent itself.

&7The short answer is hybrid. You can mix a Bard with another build or however you'd like. For example, you can be a support with damage by going into Archery gear, or mage, or healer! It's up to you.
&eUnlock Tier II Frost and Healer Guide
&eFrost focuses on dealing moderate damage while providing utility such as slowing down enemies.
&7Besides Frost Power, its main focus is &eSpell Haste&7 to cast as fast as possible. &eCritical Chance and Damage&7 are also good stats, although not a priority.
&eArcane is a high damage element focused on slower but harder spells.
&7It's the Burstiest of all 3. Focuses on &eCritical Damage&7 to maximize damage dealt by critical spells. &eCritical Chance&7 is also important, balancing out both is a good idea.
&7Your next upgrade if you choose to go as a Haste Rogue. The Assassin Set provides +5%% Haste per piece, making it ideal for your build.
&7Physical Damage and Haste nodes should be top priority. For fate, choose &9Shadow Techniques&7 as it increases your Haste by a lot.
&7Your next upgrade is the Ranger Armor, as it provides the highest Ranged Damage, useful for your build.
&7Shortbows or Rapid Crossbows are the best options for DPS due to their low draw speed.
&7Pick all Ranged Damage options and as a Fate, get &9Sin'dorei Heritage
&7Your next upgrade is the Ranger Armor, as it provides the highest Ranged Damage, useful for your build.
&7Longbows or Heavy Crossbows are the best options for Burst due to their high damage. Alternatively you can use a Veiled Crossbow for slightly faster draw speeds.
&7Pick all Ranged Damage options and as a Fate, get &9Sin'dorei Heritage
&eThe next upgrade comes from killing a Mutant Skeleton to get its chestplate.
&7On the weapon side, you can also upgrade your Shortbow/Rapid Crossbow. For the accessories side, get the respective necklace and rings.
&eThe next upgrade is getting a better burst-oriented weapon.
&7You should upgrade to a Crystal Longbow / Ruby Heavy Crossbow. For the accessories side, get the respective necklace and rings.
&7As an upgrade, you can obtain the Prior set, which increases your holy power by a percentage instead of flat, boosting your Staff's Holy Power.
&7On Tier IV, you should obtain the &6Orion &7artifact, as it's the only bow artifact.
&7You can also branch out to three different spellbooks that interact directly with Orion depending on its upgrade tree;
&eFire is a high damage element that doesn't provide utility but provides very high damage with high critical chance focus.

&7As a Fire mage you deal high constant damage but lack of high burst options, to mitiage this you can focus more on &eCritical Damage&7, but your main priority should be &eCritical Chance&7 to have crits as constant as possible.
&7Your next upgrade as a tank is switching from Diamond to Netherite.
&7You can choose &9Righteous Hammers &7for a more dps focus, or &9Bone Armor&7 for pure resistance with a taunt.
&7As for Fate, your main focus should always be &9S'kellak's Blessing&7.
&7Netherite-Diamond will be your preferred upgrade from Netherite so you can upgrade to Sapphire afterwards.
&7If you'd prefer more armor with a bit of health over sapphire's lower armor but higher health, you can craft the &7Warden Armor&7, but it's based on preference.
&7Sapphire Armor is the direct upgrade from Netherite-Diamond, it has less total armor but provides +20 Maximum Health per piece, and a passive that reflects damage dealt to you.
&7If you'd prefer more armor with a bit of health over sapphire's lower armor but higher health, you can craft the &7Warden Armor&7, but it's based on preference.
&eTopaz Armor&7 is also an alternative, as although it doesn't provide health, it does provide the highest armor toughness along with the same armor level as Warden.
&7Upgrading your Holy Staff is an essential step before moving to your Artifact Weapon.
&7Obtain the &9Ekavar&7 Artifact Weapon and use its Upgrade Tree to evolve it to &eAd'anel, Secret of Ain&7.
&7Now that you've reached enough level to get a Fate Talent, you should choose &9Frost Archmage &7over anything.
&7Now that you've reached enough level to get a Fate Talent, you should choose &9Fire Archmage &7over anything.
&7Now that you've reached enough level to get a Fate Talent, you should choose &9Arcane Archmage &7over anything.
&7The Magus Set is your next upgrade for armor, crafted from Magus' drops, recommended for level 50 onwards, as Magus is a Void's Invasion Chapter II boss.
&7A Mageseeker Hat can be used if you want to proritize critical damage.

&7Many artifacts can be used as Spellblades, as most also grant a spell power of a kind. For fire, you have &6A'zhar&7. For Frost, you have &6Frostmourne&7. For Fire \& Arcane, you have &6Ash'edar&7, and finally, for Astral you have &6Supernova&7.
&eThe final choice for all mages is Ekavar, the Great Cinderstone Staff.
&7The difficulty will depend on the previous Spell Book you chose in Tier III.
&7Your next upgrade for Spellblades are the Runic armor sets, along with alternative spellblade spellbooks.
&eElemental Wizards are proficent in three elements; Fire, Frost and Arcane.
&7Your damage will not be as high as a devoted mage, but you will be very versatile, and later on obtain the means to cast multiple elements at once, known as &dAstral Magic&7.
&eWarriors are melee builds that swing slow but hard.
&7They are the definition of a "Burst" class; as although they swing slow their damage will be high, just not as constant as a DPS build.
&eWarriors are melee builds that swing slow but hard.
&7They are the definition of a "Burst" class; as although they swing slow their damage will be high, just not as constant as a DPS build.
&7Souldancer becomes your next upgrade after Assassin, as it provides the highest Haste out of any armor set of this tier.
&7An alternative path of the Rogue is a Monk, which uses Fist weapons. You can get a Fist of Fury for those builds.
&eDeath Knights are warriors who fell into Death's Call.
&7They can be high attack speed DPS focused (Frost), or Burst and AoE focused (Unholy).
&7Their main weapon are Runeblades, as they provide all three Death Knight powers.
&7The third Death Knight type is Blood. It's a tank class, that's why it's not included in this path. If you're interested in it, go towards the Protector's Path instead.
&eUnholy Death Knights are a Burst and AoE focused class.
&7Your preferred weapons are two handed Great Runeblades. For armor, choose the Plaguebringer set, which you will keep on future tiers.
&eFrost Death Knights are DPS builds that deal a mix of physical and frost damage.
&7Your preferred weapons are one handed Runeblades, and the Frozen Chamption armor set, which you will keep for future tiers.
&7For armor, upgrade it to the netherite tier, as they'll be the best for damage and protection.
&6Frostmourne&7 is made for Death Knights, making it the best choice for any Death Knight build.
&eBlood Death Knights have less protection, but high health and self-sustain.
